books.title: Wild Animals I Have Known
books.author: Ernest Thompson Seton
books.summary: Eight short stories about the lives of various animals across several regions of North America.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Swiss Family Robinson
books.author: Johann David Wyss
books.summary: A Swiss family is shipwrecked on a remote island in the East Indies.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: Measure for Measure
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A duke pretends to leave Vienna so that he can observe his deputy’s management during his supposed absence.

books.title: The Water of the Wondrous Isles
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: A beautiful woman escapes a life of servitude under an evil witch to adventure through a series of magical islands.

books.title: Doctor Syn
books.author: Russell Thorndike
books.summary: A king’s enforcer searching for smugglers uncovers the dark past of the inhabitants of a small English town.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Seven Dials Mystery
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A weekend party at a country mansion ends in murder, and the daughter of the lord of the estate joins Superintendent Battle in investigating.

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Okakura Kakuzō
books.summary: The Book of Tea is a long essay exploring the relationship between teaism, taoism, and the aesthetics of Japanese culture.

books.title: Two Treatises of Government
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: Locke critiques the concepts of absolute monarchy and divine right, arguing instead for a government founded on natural rights, individual freedom, and the consent of the governed, which protects the fundamental rights of life, liberty, and property.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Georgia Douglas Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by Georgia Douglas Johnson.

books.title: Main Street
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

books.title: We
books.author: Yevgeny Zamyatin
books.summary: A thousand years in the future, the builder of a spaceship discovers his emotions.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
